title: Scientific Thinking and Technology – Exploring, Scientific Inquiry, and Discovery
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

FC2AFFCEB62B4BEB965EBAB366E848F0.description: Examine and explore different careers and discuss the similarities and differences in the way that those careers use technology .

E622796F603D410086EE493341ECD76F.description: Act out roles’ scientists, engineers, technologists, and others who work with technology .

C49010D3B63B4C55844ACA76542140FA.description: Discuss the roles of scientists, engineers, technologists, and others who work with technology.

37AA9DE7418941FE937D2EC8A006C34C.description: NATURE AND CHARACTERISTICS OF TECHNOLOGY AND ENGINEERING

4F9357BF7F5543A28D962E86B9E8218E.description: Develop a plan in order to complete a task.

42495D2BA12647CC8102ED60B1D42136.description: INTEGRATION OF KNOWLEDGE, TECHNOLOGIES, AND PRACTICES

A9F7112E523A42489E11D6EB056073C8.description: Apply design concepts, principles, and processes through play and exploration.

310E56C9C04A476F9ACDDD1286361F64.description: Take things apart and put them back together

97529EFB840B4638AAD566EA726E5716.description: Observe and discuss how things work .

4F723420F27A47658920BC9AEAA330F6.description: Ask questions about how things work .

18E16C13CFF5476B9B359A7F28B4EB7B.description: Engage is listening, questioning, and discussing .

7E5CC50269A64DEAAA322B8A579BCAD7.description: Participate in simple investigations to determine how things work.

EE8F706EA3844C57B80652DFE2F98C00.description: Improve – Refine the design, create the solution, communicate the results .

7F98213906F34F9E9E4337C3697765A8.description: Create – Develop a design proposal . Make or model a prototype . Test and evaluate .

1C82A5DD6FBA41ACADE9C350A6FF4E42.description: Plan – Research ideas and explore possibilities . Establish criteria and constraints . Consider alternative solutions and select an approach .

3207D0551EDF4B9FA04BF2C74547F762.description: Participate in activities that use the steps of the engineering design process

67273ECF5C014F2AB90EDB0F62B37777.description: Identify the steps of the engineering design process (Ask, Imagine, Plan, Create, Improve) .

19B44BC436084762851CD1361FB4F149.description: Demonstrate essential skills of the engineering design process.

EB06C89B88794468BEAEAD1D692215CC.description: DESIGN AND DESIGN THINKING IN TECHNOLOGY AND ENGINEERING EDUCATION

26F9B69890AA43F283250CF780E51997.description: Choose tools that are appropriate for an identified task .

7DD4E18C6356489788E7B59B61283C99.description: Follow established rules (e .g ., time limit, handling with care, putting away) when using tools .

B2D058FE787541459D2434A39D09710C.description: Discuss the ways in which tools can be used safely .

9626D31D725947859D19C8E4DE2090FB.description: Safely use tools to complete tasks.

8BEDC8C5077F476A8246051ED4844DB6.description: Discuss how technology use could be helpful or harmful .

3380F7C08E86402BAE96A2A7A399D0F0.description: Identify how technology affects daily lives .

3604E14D3EF3482699B25829AD40F4D2.description: Label technology with appropriate vocabulary when using or shown (e .g ., telephone, cell phone, computer, TV, camera, tablet, e-reader, Smart board) .

F85C1C084957473C9F7B2494781546BD.description: Explain the helpful and harmful effects of technology.

C67C07E3C5CC4982BECDE2725E5A62ED.description: Label technology with appropriate vocabulary when using or shown (e .g ., telephone, cell phone, computer, TV, camera, tablet, e-reader, Smart board) .

0BFFB86716BB44A4B4CAD2422F6B49E0.description: Identify various technologies used in everyday life.

DB3F6DEA2C884E5BA6DBD0C910DFC947.description: Use symbols to represent or communicate an idea or a solution to a problem .

A7FA033F7BBC44FAB295E97339439AD8.description: Label symbols including road signs, symbols for persons with disabilities, and icons on a screen .

0B5348A6C6194DEBAF77A8080817C6A0.description: APPLYING, MAINTAINING, AND ASSESSING TECHNOLOGICAL PRODUCTS AND SYSTEMS

CB5F003A1864498488DC0CC30EFFA183.description: Practice recycling as part of classroom routine .

A816C12ACD2A483EBF61C53C312E840F.description: Sort waste into those things that can be recycled and those things that cannot .

404FC20C046D4DDE9BF3249CA4061DFC.description: Identify ways that litter should be handled .

4606843B935948B69EC7EF9B1117B97B.description: Participate in experiments that show how litter can impact the environment .

57EE8D8BDBD04F2B8DDE7CDB58AD314D.description: Identify how litter can have a negative impact on the environment .

CD3D5A1F184E4F52917611AC32D13414.description: Engage in activities that reduce the impact of humans on the local environment.

CD2B4402828146D1B3D96AC987BB553D.description: Label human needs as air, food, water, shelter, clothing .

3D4F74C0234F45699A5B7CC5F91B126A.description: Discuss and use natural items collected from the immediate environment .

B24A3CBD30284083A69D941D1765C707.description: Understand that natural resources are materials that come from the environment and are used by people .

B704DCD2EC054EC9872B0F20A44C2094.description: Match simple items used by people to its natural resource (e .g ., milk to cow, wood for building to tree, wool to sheep) .

421AF5EFC109495DB6B292EDC0FB4647.description: Understand that the things we use can be made from things found in the environment .

B019EBF896A84B9F9BA25E8F5D27F06E.description: State that living things need air, food, and water to survive .

0D61E49F691849BF92B3412D17FEA9F4.description: Identify natural resources available to people in their daily lives.

95A291A767AD4FD488D5B699DE4C8C2C.description: AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS AND RESOURCES

3DAFC7D7107F4CD2BDA4BFDBBD76105D.description: Talk about current weather events that affect the community .

3617E391BD9D4E978094182D6340F6F1.description: Use a thermometer as a tool for measuring temperature .

D6A5E10463AA465A98DDD4E4CBB27982.description: Match types of clothing or activities to seasonal weather conditions (e .g ., we use an umbrella when it is raining; we wear coats, hats, scarves, and mittens when it’s cold outside) .

E2EFD20EE072414D8DBC7C6956E20EC5.description: Name the four seasons and an observable condition for that season (e .g ., falling leaves, snow, rain, buds on trees, or green grass) .

078BFB4045684D198F08D9D76EEEADA1.description: Identify seasons that correspond with observable conditions and identify how weather affects daily life.

3A74E0F7F22447AD821260779A8D1FAB.description: Use tools and materials to design and build a structure that will reduce the warming effect of sunlight on an area .

9163C50046994D7E86E9B1363F988ECD.description: Comment on the impact an object has when placed between the sun and the earth’s surface (e .g ., umbrellas, canopies, and tents) .

50EBB574EDC34C67A81603AA22AE8B55.description: Participate in simple investigations that will reduce the warming effect of sunlight.

4CEDE5079CBD4AF4AAE429313B76D1C8.description: Participate in investigations of the effect of the sun on the earth’s surface .

66A7A704C2574D6F8BBD22A96A35EB29.description: Understand the earth’s surface could include rocks, sand, soil, water .

A38852C931114164A19FFDEB117F6BE1.description: Recognize that light from the sun has an effect on the earth’s surface.

4DEAA17406E740C284009D0F07A22D75.description: CONSERVATION OF ENERGY AND ENERGY TRANSFER

4DFA443B43FD45E08BF333BDFF132275.description: Push or pull objects using varying strengths and directions

CE13D0EF4B344A21A8147DD56F3998C1.description: Make predictions about an outcome (e .g ., What might happen to a car that is pushed up or down a hill?) .

7339198FD2ED4DDDBA871A89DEB26333.description: Participate in activities that involve changes in strength and direction in the pushing and pulling of objects and discuss the outcomes .

412499420F994F49B684C58579597BC5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of push and pull .

53F2F3E42BE34917B47B9B399413C912.description: Participate in investigations to compare the effects of different strengths or different directions of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object.

ACD729ECB5AA480D9D4D4852B018D9BF.description: Push or pull objects with varying size, shape, and weights .

09CC9A5B654F4197812E7912B7768E72.description: Make predictions about an outcome (e .g ., What might happen to a kite when the wind blows or slows down?) .

59991D5F6ECD4AAD9A4114034B1F94FD.description: Experiment with objects or ideas to obtain a result .

5F17939A86CE4448BDDB6E4DC0B33128.description: Use the five sense and simple equipment to gather data .

BF1F7488BCF14DE0BB94CF1A40C959D8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of fast, slow, back, forth, start and stop .

FF0FC74613224FD1A66CA106D8643951.description: omment about the speed or direction of objects during play .

4A0D9DD49B8249B98DB463A22CCE5569.description: Participate in investigations to determine if a design solution works as intended to change the speed or direction of an object with a push or a pull.

EB2ED75E9A9D4A099641478B61384AAE.description: Experiment with changes in substances when combined .

B0FA3CBF2EF04F0EBE9834E9EE7F263D.description: Notice changes in food substances during cooking .

20F6FAC5C547443E96924C2B6809FBE5.description: Observe differences in water (e .g ., ice cube or snow melting and freezing) .

B2FD1AF287FD4273844320F39FBFFCFD.description: Point out when a change in matter occurs .

36815D784BB4418B9408EB72B80A2CC7.description: Make a prediction about the results of the experiment .

52F8D286453E4BC58180AE2F9A09FDF1.description: Use the five senses and simple equipment to gather data .

EA8AE97D35204F3C8B267E7546C03B7A.description: Recognize that matter takes on different shapes depending upon its type (e .g ., solids have a definite shape, liquids take the shape of their container, gas lacks shape and is present everywhere) .

081FBD67F27C42E3A9E83C34F501B57F.description: Collect items and sort them according to shape, color, or other attributes .

5FCFA79FCF5C4D50BF864F06A03C2DBD.description: Describe objects according to size, shape, color, or properties of matter .

6DC15EE32AC145849748E8F9B76B596C.description: Recognize the different types of matter (e .g ., solid, liquid, gas) .

02415A133582491B84FFB46A98ECF3D6.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties.

7D1768EA998347CFA3E192E5ADE624E2.description: Identify changes that occur to animals during the seasons

9167B2CB91254561BE81EC281CB2B926.description: Care for plants and animals in the classroom .

37879E0678E24577AE93832AD2FC5734.description: Describe changes in people and animals over time (e .g ., losing teeth, growing out of clothing, beans sprouting) .

4391FC0950044043B48007A877D6A91B.description: Observe and document the growth of a living thing through drawings, writing, and/or photos .

ADC8C617180B4F9DB7DC23B82EDC9BC0.description: Make a prediction about the result of the experiment

FC8DE2EF28994BDA98ACBD84E85BF496.description: Collect objects during a nature walk .

A2B30D826440411EB9CD95F6FA22AEF6.description: Use the five senses and simple equipment to gather data .

7970847490FF4D03ACC6BA9C3DD6EB60.description: Ask questions about objects, organisms, and events .

8D7813289CC94B7C845EF92D66114251.description: Draw a picture of a person, an animal, or a plant including most of the major observable features .

1FD99EA177C34D748F88F5926B31BD9E.description: Tell the parts of a person, animal, or plant .

333BA5DA470F411ABFB05363E2AED827.description: Observe the effect of darkness and light on growing plants .

E5A6C8D7588F41819D38E3EC50871233.description: State that living things need air, food, and water to survive .

EE807D14093347EA82449F409530753C.description: Categorize common living things into plants and animals .

E7F9E68464A64CF39E8867ADF2D9E3E4.description: Sort objects by living and non-living .

12A31F309BF443A3BBA53A574532AB1D.description: Use observations to identify and describe what plants and animals (including humans) need to survive.

30856276638C4E7D9E42A514DEF9390E.description: ORGANIZATION FOR MATTER AND ENERGY FLOW IN ORGANISMS
